intro: Aloe collina, commonly known as the mountain aloe, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It features fleshy, rosette-shaped leaves that are typically green with a waxy texture. The plant produces upright, branched inflorescences bearing yellow or orange flowers. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves. Aloe collina is often used in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant.
